intro: Moquilea mattogrossensis, commonly known as the Brazilian moquilea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Brazilian state of Mato Grosso. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and savannas. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a rough texture. Moquilea mattogrossensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and potential ecological role in its native environment.
